Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: At least once a year, I like to bring in some of my Kevin's Famous Chili. The trick is to undercook the onions. Everybody is going to get to know each other in the pot. I'm serious about this stuff. I'm up the night before pressing garlic and dicing whole tomatoes. I toast my own Ancho chilies. It's a recipe passed down from Malone's for generations. It's probably the thing I do best.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Someone is returning! He started his own company, and now he's back. Who could it be? I'll give you a hint. He is a man. A man you have missed with all your heart. A man who has ruined all other men for you. Who is it?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: [whispering] Who is it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispering] Who is it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [whispering] It's Michael Scott. [applause; Michael jumps through sign] Hold it up. Conference room, five minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, I guess the first order of business is to welcome back me, and Pam and Ryan. [scattered applause] And how about casual Friday again, huh? Reinstituting casual Friday? You all look great. What I want to do right now is try something a little different. I'm going to throw it out there, starting with this meeting. I want you guys to run it. I want you to say whatever you want, take it away. Your meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [after a few moments of silence] Wh-what are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If there is something that you would like to say as a group, then by all means, you may say it to me right now.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: People are dressed inappropriately.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Take it up with Toby. What I want you to do, is I want you to look inward. And I want you to reflect. And I want you to say something different.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can you give us a hint?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: When I needed salespeople for my new paper company, everyone here turned their back on me. Am I going to ask them to beg for forgiveness? No. Am I going to ask for big, crying apology? No. Am I going to ask them to slit their wrists for me? No. I just want a tiny, microscopic version of that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oscar, what were you going to say?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Nothing. I didn't say anything.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Do I still have a job here?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Not important. [everyone mutters] Okay, alright. Yes. Yes, you have a job. Frankly, you have a job because Ryan and Pam are starting with us as salesmen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Wait, what?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: How is that going to work?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's going to work very smoothly, because Pam and Ryan are bringing over a ton of clients from Michael Scott Paper Company and-

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You mean the clients you stole from us.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah , aren't we getting those clients back?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you lost those clients.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I call foul, sir.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You were bought out. So the company then bought out all of the stolen clients.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, Dwight. Let me explain something to you. I set the rules and you follow them. Blindly. Okay? And if you have a problem with that then you can talk to our complaint department. It's a trash can.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [to Ryan] Don't fall in love with me, kid.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] Boscov's at the Steamtown Mall?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It sure looked good on the mannequin.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Well, you have good taste.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well, thanks. I sure wish I had more time to talk to my clients, though.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Isn't that what you said to a bunch of my clients when you were stealing them? That I didn't have enough time for them?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, I, um...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Close your mouth, sweetie. You look like a trout.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: The man is wearing sandals. I don't need to see Oscar's toes at work. Gross! I mean he looks like he just got off the boat.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Can't you just not look at his feet?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Excuse me? Oh. You're so educated, aren't you Toby? So trained to deal with a hysterical woman. I don't want to look at his feet. [storms off] Do your job!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, I was in the Seminary for a year and dropped out 'cause I wanted to have sex with this girl, Cathy. Followed her to Scranton. Took the first job I could find in H.R. Later she divorced me. So no, I wouldn't say I have a passion for H.R.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [hands Ryan a soda] There you are, my friend.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks, man.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pamela.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Fresh hot ink.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: "New File System".

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Trust me, Stanley, you're going to want to read this memo very carefully.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I am not changing the way I do my files.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, no. This goes for all of you. Believe me, you are going to want to heat my words.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When held over heat the invisible ink will reveal that everyone should meet at the warehouse immediately. Do not ask me where I got the invisible ink. Urine. It was urine.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'm sorry you're offended by my shoes, but I am not going to drive home to change.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I could loan you a pair of socks.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No, they're clean. I was going to wear them to volleyball practice later.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Andrew Bernard.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Okay, what are you still doing at your desk?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What are you still doing not at your desk?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Did you even read the memo?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: All my files are now in reverse alphabetical order-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, you idiot. There is a code embedded in the memo. Listen, you need to round up all the salesmen, except for Ryan and Pam, and get them down to the warehouse pronto.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, it is on like a prawn who yawns at dawn.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stop doing rhyming poetry. Just tell them, please. God, the simplest thing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We're in crisis mode here, do you understand? The two unqualified so-called salespeople are being favored because they all failed together. And frankly, I'm not convinced that Michael and Pam didn't have a thing going while they were gone.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I address that?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, you're too close.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stanley, how do you feel about those two taking your clients?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: It's not right. I don't like it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He doesn't like it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You don't take my clients away and give them to a secretary. [sighs] No offense, Jim. I think she's very pretty.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Her face is okay, but- Jesus! What -what are you doing here?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I don't know. I saw a crowd. I thought there might be a dogfight or something-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Get out! We need to do something. I'm thinking maybe a coup or we take Ryan hostage.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Those sound too harsh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, I'm not saying we do those things. I'm saying something like those things.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Of course. What is like a hostage?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excellent question.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We could write a strong-worded letter.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Words will never be enough.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Strongly-painted picture.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, pictures are too interpretive.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I just say something? I know that tempers are high, but I think the best way to handle this might be to just talk to Michael directly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh. Well, that-that's a great idea, Jim. Oh, I totally see your point. Okay, we'll talk to Michael directly. So uh, meeting is over, I guess. I'll see everyone upstairs.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great. See you upstairs.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: C'mon. [whispers] Guys. Psst, listen. Now is the time for action. I'm talking action-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: That one's great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I know.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You look so classy in that picture.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I do? Well-Where is that bowl?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, you have a second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Michael Scott Paper Company only.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah, I think you're going to want to cool it with that 'cause it's starting to upset the other salesmen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, well--

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Tough.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I will-no, no. I'll talk to them when they all get back from the bathroom.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is awkward to talk about, but there may or may not be-but definitely is-a mutiny forming in the warehouse right now.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Against who?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You. Us.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's gotta be because they all want their clients.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: The old Michael Scott might have taken this, but not the new Michael Scott. They are in for a bitter surprise. I am not to be truffled with.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Six weeks ago, none of these people wanted to come with me. You two were the only ones with the stones to follow.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mm-hmmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was us, right there.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We were something else.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What you gotta do is you gotta go down to that warehouse and you gotta crack some skulls.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Chiklis style.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, the Commish.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yes, but Chiklis Shield style. Not Commish style.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah. The Shield.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: It's crazy what's going on out there today, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I know. Yeah, it's...kinda-

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Sometimes it's best just to say out of it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's true. That's right. Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Want to play a game?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey gang. Where you been?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Lunch.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Where'd you eat?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: A restaurant.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What'd you have, Stanley?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I had a salmon salad. With water, no ice. I was going to get a soda, but the waiter talked me out of it. Her name was Flo, she had black hair.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I had Mexican food.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So since you guys already ate, you won't be eating the stuff you brought with you for lunch, will you? [walks into kitchen] Oh, wow, Stanley. Is that egg salad? Andy brought some salmon.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: That looks great.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, is that a meat sandwich? You guys hungry?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I can eat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm going to o have some of this meat sandwich.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's pony.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mom. What kind of sauce is on your salmon?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Dijonnaise.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmm. Thanks for going out, guys.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey, Meredith. Can I talk to you privately for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: About what?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Your outfit.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What? What's wrong with my outfit?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You-you might consider pulling it down a touch. It's ri-it's riding up a little high.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: A bunch of prudes. You know, Oscar's allowed to wear sandals, but I'm not allowed to wear open-toed shoes? [pulls down dress, office gasps] Is that how it goes?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Meredith, your boob is out.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Fine. [pulls dress up, everyone gasps again]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Meredith, too far!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Dammit, Meredith, where are your panties?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: It's casual day. Happy? [bends over to get a file, exposing herself to the office]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [playing chess with Jim] No. IF you do that, I'm gonna do that. IF you do that, I'm gonna do that. IF you do this, I'm gonna do that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, what if I just do this?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: You don't want to do that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm just hiding out until all this stuff blows over. With Creed. Playing chess. At work. He's winning. I feel like I'm describing a dream I had.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm sorry you feel that way, Mr. Bart. Is there anything I can do to make things better?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa. Give me the phone. Give me the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's my client.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Exactly. This is your first complaint in ten years.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Give me the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Things have been generally good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Give me the phone. Tell him Dwight Schrute wants to talk to him.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Look, uh, Mr. Bart...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hi, Mr. Bart.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: At these prices with this service...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey, it's Dwight here. Give me the phone.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You're not gonna find this anywhere else.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Dwight Schrute here. Hey, don't hang up.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No, no, no. Sir, don't listen.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know times are tough right now, and I laud your thriftiness. [tries to pull phone out of Ryan's hand] Ryan!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ryan, hand the phone over.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Stop flustering me, everybody!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Who let this boy on the phone?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ah! Mr. Bart! Ugh! [slams phone down[ I cannot believe you lost that account. He was my client for ten years!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You made him lose the account by screaming at him the entire time. It's okay, Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're a secretary! What do you know?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And you're a temp and I'm taking your phone. I'm confiscating this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, hey guys. You know what I want you to do? Shake hands, get over it. That was not a shake, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We want our clients back or we quit, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Who quits?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Me.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: And me.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Me too.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You guys gotta be kidding.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, we gotta be deadly serious. We'll start our own paper company. The Schrute-Bernard-Lapin-Vance...Stanley Paper Company.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I love it. I love this idea, and I fully support you. As a matter of fact, I'm going to give you some seed money. [throws money at Phyllis] There you go. There's some seed money for you. And you can take it, no hard feelings. But if you stay, I want an apology, and I want a big one.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: You want us to apologize to you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes I do.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's completely backwards.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's frontward's.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, you thought you were attacking corporate, but we were the ones who got hurt. You should be apologizing to us.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That's right.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, you always said we were a family. Then you went after us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No matter how I look at this, I am in the wrong. And I have looked at this thing, like a hundred different ways. From my point of view, from their point of view...98 others. And the bottom line, I am in the wrong. I'm the bad guy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I need you to arrange a meeting between me and the sales staff without Ryan and Pam knowing.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Gasp. Are you talking about a secret meeting?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whatever you guys did earlier.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't know that first things about secret meetings.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just do it, okay?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll do-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Get 'em there. Get 'em there.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'll do the best I can.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Are you kidding me?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Deceit does not come easy to me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, okay, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I really love your outfit.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Thank you so much for saying that. I can't believe that Toby thinks this is inappropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: You look like J-Lo.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So from the bottom of my heart to the top of my heart, I am sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Are you giving us our clients back?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If we could just focus and go down the line, and everyone would say, "apology accepted", I think we would all feel better. And then we can break out my gift to you-complimentary white chocolate bark.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Nobody likes that stuff except for you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: They wouldn't make it unless people liked it.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Michael, just give us our clients back. That's all we care about.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. If I give you your clients back there won't be enough clients for Ryan and Pam, and I promised both of them they were gonna be salespeople.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: So?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fine, have your clients. I can see that's what you wanted all along. [everyone mutters "okay"] However, I rescind my apology.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's fair.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You are not reacting at all as I had hoped.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What'd I tell you about building forts in my warehouse?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael gave all of our clients back to their old salespeople, so now there's not enough for both me and Pam to stay on.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He can only keep one of us as a salesperson now. He'll make his decision by the end of the day.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I think you should get it. You really grew into it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. I think you should get it. You've changed a lot and you'd be good at it.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: If you really think that, will you tell that to Michael? That would go a long way coming from you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: So hey, I'm want to set you up with my daughter.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, I'm engaged to Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I thought you were gay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Then why would you want to set me up with your daughter?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Jim. Can I talk to you for a minute?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sure. Let me just finish this turn.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [puts Scrabble pieces on board] And Bingo was his name. Let's go.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Challenge.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I need your help. This whole Pam/Ryan debate is screwing with my head.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't want to be biased, but I am very close to Ryan. You know that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You're close with Pam too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Eh, she's nice, I guess. You know what? Best thing to do, Pros and Cons list.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pro for Ryan, he went to business school, he's my number one choice.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Well, that's-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I like his hair.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Cons, Ryan. He defrauded the company. He has never made a sale.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: He definitely stole my iPod.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That sounds pretty biased.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You didn't hear my pros. Environmentally-conscious 'cause his mom drives him to work everyday.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. Pam, pros.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Mm-hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I like her. I think that she is a fast learner. Cons, she doesn't always follow through. Sh-New York and the whole art school thing. And Roy. She has a weird voice.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's not true.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't need to tell you that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think she'd be a really good salesperson.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't think you are being totally impartial though, because you haven't said one bad thing about Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I won't.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. So be it, then you've lost credibility. And I'm going to go with my guy, and that's Ryan.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: All right. You're right, sometimes when she's tired, she can be a little bit shrill. But that's not a weird voice.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, wow! Whoa!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Take it easy.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ho-ho, man! Wow. [in a high-pitched voice] Honey! I want you to bring the garbage out. 'Cause I'm not going to have sex with you unless you bring out the garba-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have a very difficult decision to make. It's like last week I was at the video store. Do I rent Devil Wears Prada again? Or do I finally get around to seeing Sophie's Choice? It is what you would call a classic difficult decision.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You don't understand clothing, Toby. You're dressed like this amorphous blob of khaki.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: All right, look, what you gotta understand is that when you come to work, you give up certain rights.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Listen up, Flenderson. You're being weak and ineffectual. I'm cowboying this meeting, okay? Here are the new rules. Earth tones only. Also, women are forbidden to wear pants.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: All right, come. Sit down, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm running this meeting.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: That's debatable.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's not. It's not. Sit down or I am writing you up.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Ooh, where has this guy been?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Casual Fridays are cancelled. [everyone protests] Let's just not do it anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're running from the problem.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: There's not a single appropriate outfit in this whole-except mine, quite honestly.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam, can you come in here, please? Have a seat. [clears throat] Well, there's no easy way of saying this. So I think I will just...drag it out. Since the dawn of time there has been-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Just tell me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I gave Ryan the sales job. There just weren't enough clients for the two of you. So I had to-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, I get it. [Michael laughs] Why are you giggling? Is this a joke? [Michael continues to laugh] Michael, is this- did I get the job?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing] Yes, you did.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I did?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: For real, you're not kidding?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you-no.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I did?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, you're the best person for the job. You're going to be great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael, thank you. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughing] Oh, oh!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you. You will not be sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You should have seen your face. Oh man! Oh, that was classic.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh. [laughing] I really thought I didn't get it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, really?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. 'Cause you said I didn't

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, man. That was really good. That was really good.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What about Ryan?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know, I offered him his temp job back. We'll see. He was not happy at all when I offered him this job and then I told him he didn't get the job, so-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Maybe you shouldn't fake fire people anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't appreciate you telling me what to do. So clean out your desk, you are through here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! What's our receptionists name?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Could you send her in?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [opens door] Erin. Michael wants to see you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Have a seat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This is very difficult to say, but no one here like you in the office and we are going to have to let you go. [pick up phone] Hank, could you come up here please? Hank is our security guard-

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, I can go.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He will be ushering you out. [starts laughing]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, your face! Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Is-do the people-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, I'm kidding. No, you're not-you're not fired. Yet.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Do they not like me, though?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't know, actually.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Okay.
